post.description:
Creates a segment using given file and pushes it to Pinot. 
 All steps happen on the controller. This API is NOT meant for production environments/large input files. 
 Example usage (query params need encoding):
```
curl -X POST -F file=@data.json -H "Content-Type: multipart/form-data" "http://localhost:9000/ingestFromFile?tableNameWithType=foo_OFFLINE&
batchConfigMapStr={
  "inputFormat":"csv",
  "recordReader.prop.delimiter":"|"
}" 
```

parameters.name: tableNameWithType
parameters.description: Name of the table to upload the file to

parameters.name: batchConfigMapStr
parameters.description: Batch config Map as json string. Must pass inputFormat, and optionally record reader properties. e.g. {"inputFormat":"json"}

post.description:
Creates a segment using file at the given URI and pushes it to Pinot. 
 All steps happen on the controller. This API is NOT meant for production environments/large input files. 
Example usage (query params need encoding):
```
curl -X POST "http://localhost:9000/ingestFromURI?tableNameWithType=foo_OFFLINE
&batchConfigMapStr={
  "inputFormat":"json",
  "input.fs.className":"org.apache.pinot.plugin.filesystem.S3PinotFS",
  "input.fs.prop.region":"us-central",
  "input.fs.prop.accessKey":"foo",
  "input.fs.prop.secretKey":"bar"
}
&sourceURIStr=s3://test.bucket/path/to/json/data/data.json"
```

parameters.name: tableNameWithType
parameters.description: Name of the table to upload the file to

parameters.name: batchConfigMapStr
parameters.description: Batch config Map as json string. Must pass inputFormat, and optionally input FS properties. e.g. {"inputFormat":"json"}

post.summary: Update the tables served by the specified broker instance in the broker resource
post.description: Broker resource should be updated when a new broker instance is added, or the tags for an existing broker are changed. Updating broker resource requires reading all the table configs, which can be costly for large cluster. Consider updating broker resource for each table individually.

get.summary: Returns state of consuming segments
get.description: Gets the status of consumers from all servers.Note that the partitionToOffsetMap has been deprecated and will be removed in the next release. The info is now embedded within each partition's state as currentOffsetsMap.

parameters.name: tableName
parameters.description: Realtime table name with or without type

post.summary: Pause consumption of a realtime table
post.description: Pause the consumption of a realtime table

post.summary: Resume consumption of a realtime table
post.description: Resume the consumption for a realtime table. ConsumeFrom parameter indicates from which offsets consumption should resume. Recommended value is 'lastConsumed', which indicates consumption should continue based on the offsets in segment ZK metadata, and in case the offsets are already gone, the first available offsets are picked to minimize the data loss.

get.summary: Return pause status of a realtime table
get.description: Return pause status of a realtime table along with list of consuming segments.

post.summary: Force commit the current consuming segments
post.description: Force commit the current segments in consuming state and restart consumption. This should be used after schema/table config changes. Please note that this is an asynchronous operation, and 200 response does not mean it has actually been done already.If specific partitions or consuming segments are provided, only those partitions or consuming segments will be force committed.

parameters.name: partitions
parameters.description: Comma separated list of partition group IDs to be committed

parameters.name: segments
parameters.description: Comma separated list of consuming segments to be committed

get.summary: Get status for a submitted force commit operation
get.description: Get status for a submitted force commit operation

delete.summary: Cancel a query as identified by the queryId
delete.description: No effect if no query exists for the given queryId on the requested broker. Query may continue to run for a short while after calling cancel as it's done in a non-blocking manner. The cancel method can be called multiple times.

parameters.name: queryId
parameters.description: QueryId as assigned by the broker

parameters.name: timeoutMs
parameters.description: Timeout for servers to respond the cancel request

404.description: Query not found on the requested broker

get.summary: Get running queries from all brokers
get.description: The queries are returned with brokers running them

get.summary: List all segments. An optional 'excludeReplacedSegments' parameter is used to get the list of segments which has not yet been replaced (determined by segment lineage entries) and can be queried from the table. The value is false by default.
get.description: List all segments

parameters.name: excludeReplacedSegments
parameters.description: Whether to exclude replaced segments in the response, which have been replaced specified in the segment lineage entries and cannot be queried from the table

parameters.name: excludeOverlapping
parameters.description: Whether to exclude the segments overlapping with the timestamps, false by default

parameters.name: retention
parameters.description: Retention period for the table segments (e.g. 12h, 3d); If not set, the retention period will default to the first config that's not null: the table config, then to cluster setting, then '7d'. Using 0d or -1d will instantly delete segments without retention

delete.summary: Delete selected segments. An optional 'excludeReplacedSegments' parameter is used to get the list of segments which has not yet been replaced (determined by segment lineage entries) and can be queried from the table. The value is false by default.

parameters.name: excludeReplacedSegments
parameters.description: Whether to ignore replaced segments for deletion, which have been replaced specified in the segment lineage entries and cannot be queried from the table, false by default

parameters.name: excludeOverlapping
parameters.description: Whether to ignore segments that are partially overlapping with the [start, end)for deletion, true by default

parameters.name: retention
parameters.description: Retention period for the table segments (e.g. 12h, 3d); If not set, the retention period will default to the first config that's not null: the table config, then to cluster setting, then '7d'. Using 0d or -1d will instantly delete segments without retention

get.description: Get the server metadata for all table segments

get.description: Get the zookeeper metadata for all table segments

get.summary: Get storage tier for all segments in the given table
get.description: Get storage tier for all segments in the given table

get.summary: Get storage tiers for the given segment
get.description: Get storage tiers for the given segment

get.summary: Get the selected segments given the (inclusive) start and (exclusive) end timestamps in milliseconds. These timestamps will be compared against the minmax values of the time column in each segment. If the table is a refresh use case, the value of start and end timestamp is voided, since there is no time column for refresh use case; instead, the whole qualified segments will be returned. If no timestamps are provided, all the qualified segments will be returned. For the segments that partially belong to the time range, the boolean flag 'excludeOverlapping' is introduced in order for user to determine whether to exclude this kind of segments in the response.
get.description: Get the selected segments given the start and end timestamps in milliseconds

parameters.name: excludeOverlapping
parameters.description: Whether to exclude the segments overlapping with the timestamps, false by default

post.summary: Rebalances a table (reassign instances and segments for a table)
post.description: Rebalances a table (reassign instances and segments for a table)

parameters.name: tableName
parameters.description: Name of the table to rebalance

parameters.name: dryRun
parameters.description: Whether to rebalance table in dry-run mode

parameters.name: reassignInstances
parameters.description: Whether to reassign instances before reassigning segments

parameters.name: includeConsuming
parameters.description: Whether to reassign CONSUMING segments for real-time table

parameters.name: bootstrap
parameters.description: Whether to rebalance table in bootstrap mode (regardless of minimum segment movement, reassign all segments in a round-robin fashion as if adding new segments to an empty table)

parameters.name: downtime
parameters.description: Whether to allow downtime for the rebalance

parameters.name: minAvailableReplicas
parameters.description: For no-downtime rebalance, minimum number of replicas to keep alive during rebalance, or maximum number of replicas allowed to be unavailable if value is negative

parameters.name: lowDiskMode
parameters.description: For no-downtime rebalance, whether to enable low disk mode during rebalance. When enabled, segments will first be offloaded from servers, then added to servers after offload is done while maintaining the min available replicas. It may increase the total time of the rebalance, but can be useful when servers are low on disk space, and we want to scale up the cluster and rebalance the table to more servers.

parameters.name: bestEfforts
parameters.description: Whether to use best-efforts to rebalance (not fail the rebalance when the no-downtime contract cannot be achieved)

parameters.name: externalViewCheckIntervalInMs
parameters.description: How often to check if external view converges with ideal states

parameters.name: externalViewStabilizationTimeoutInMs
parameters.description: How long to wait till external view converges with ideal states

parameters.name: heartbeatIntervalInMs
parameters.description: How often to make a status update (i.e. heartbeat)

parameters.name: heartbeatTimeoutInMs
parameters.description: How long to wait for next status update (i.e. heartbeat) before the job is considered failed

parameters.name: maxAttempts
parameters.description: Max number of attempts to rebalance

parameters.name: retryInitialDelayInMs
parameters.description: Initial delay to exponentially backoff retry

parameters.name: updateTargetTier
parameters.description: Whether to update segment target tier as part of the rebalance

delete.summary: Cancel all rebalance jobs for the given table, and noop if no rebalance is running
delete.description: Cancel all rebalance jobs for the given table, and noop if no rebalance is running

parameters.name: tableName
parameters.description: Name of the table to rebalance
